name: Traefik
description: Traefik (pronounced traffic) is a modern HTTP reverse proxy and load balancer that makes deploying microservices easy.

name: Project V
description: Project V is a set of network tools that help you to build your own computer network. It secures your network connections and thus protects your privacy.

name: Kong
description: Kong is a cloud-native, fast, scalable, and distributed Microservice Abstraction Layer (also known as an API Gateway, API Middleware or in some cases Service Mesh).

name: Envoy
description: Envoy is hosted by the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF).

name: OpenWrt
description: The OpenWrt Project is a Linux operating system targeting embedded devices.

name: Scapy
description: Scapy is a powerful Python-based interactive packet manipulation program and library.

name: OpenVPN
description: The OpenVPN Management interface allows OpenVPN to be administratively controlled from an external program via a TCP or unix domain socket.

name: FreeRDP
description: FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP), released under the Apache license.

name: Libwebsockets (LWS)
description: A flexible, lightweight pure C library for implementing modern network protocols easily with a tiny footprint, using a nonblocking event loop.

name: pfSense
description: A free network firewall distribution, based on the FreeBSD operating system with a custom kernel and including third party free software packages for additional functionality.

name: LuCI
description: This is the OpenWrt luci"-feed containing LuCI - OpenWrt Configuration Interface."

name: Open vSwitch
description: Open vSwitch is a multilayer software switch licensed under the open source Apache 2 license.

name: Portable OpenSSH
description: A port of OpenBSD's OpenSSH to most Unix-like operating systems, including Linux, OS X and Cygwin. Portable OpenSSH polyfills OpenBSD APIs that are not available elsewhere, adds sshd sandboxing for more operating systems and includes support for OS-native authentication and auditing (e.g. using PAM).

name: OpenStack Compute (nova)
description: A cloud computing fabric controller, supporting a wide variety of compute technologies, including: libvirt (KVM, Xen, LXC and more), Hyper-V, VMware, XenServer, OpenStack Ironic and PowerVM.
